The Elder Nun Siṅgālamātā’s Verses
“The Victor Padumuttara,

analyzed: sabba dhammāna pāragū  i taḥ sata sahassamhi
translated: who had gone beyond all things,🔽appeared as a leader🔽a hundred thousand eons ago.
At that time I was born
in the family of the rich and powerful,🔽the Haṁsavati clan,
with various jewels and lights,
and great wealth.
Going with my father,
with a great crowd in front,
having heard the Buddha’s Teaching,
I went forth into homelessness.
Having gone forth, with my body🔽I avoided bad actions,
and having given up bad speech,
I purified my livelihood.
With confidence in the Buddha and the Teaching,
and with great respect for the Sangha,
I was intent on listening to the true Teaching,
and eager to see the Buddha.
I heard that the foremost of those confident in faith🔽was a nun,

analyzed: assosim bhikkhunim tadā  tam ṭhānam patthayitvāna
translated: and aspiring to that state,
I fulfilled the three trainings.
Then the Gracious One said to me,
with a heart full of compassion:
‘One who has confidence in the Realised One,
whose faith is well-established and unshakable,
Noble, praiseworthy virtue,
Who has confidence in the Saṅgha,
And has a straight view,
They say he is not poor,

original: amoghaṁ tassa jīvitaṁ.🔽Tasmā saddhañca sīlañca,🔽pasādaṁ dhammadassanaṁ;
analyzed: amogham tassa jīvita  tasmai saddhañca sīlañca  pasādam dhamma dassana
translated: his life is not fruitless.🔽Therefore the wise one should practice🔽Confidence, virtue,
Confidence, and the view of the Dhamma,
Remembering the Buddha’s instruction.’
Having heard that, I was delighted,
and asked about my aspiration.
Then the incomparable, immeasurable,
the leader, declared:
‘Confidence in the Buddha is good,
you will attain what you have wished for.
After a hundred thousand eons,
born in the family of the crows,
with the name of Gotama,
you will be a teacher in the world.
You will be a heir to his Dhamma,
with the Dhamma as your flesh and blood,
the mother of Siṅgāla,
a disciple of the Teacher.’
Having heard that, I was delighted,
and for the rest of my life,🔽I served the Victor,
with a loving mind, with practice, with the leader.
By that good deed well done,
by the intention and the aspiration,
Having abandoned the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
And in my last existence now,
in the supreme city of Giribbaja;
I was born in an affluent merchant family,
a great store of jewels.
You are my son named Siṅgāla,
delighting in the wrong path;
Wandering in the thicket of views,
devoted to worshipping the directions.
Seeing him worshipping various directions,
wandering for alms in the city,
The Buddha, the guide, seeing him,
stood on the road and advised him.
Hearing the Dhamma he was teaching,
the noise-maker became frightened;
Two koṭis of men and women
attained the realization of the Dhamma.
Then I went to the assembly
and heard the Sugata's speech;
Attaining the fruit of stream-entry,
I went forth into homelessness.
Not long after that,
eager to see the Buddha,
Developing that recollection,
I attained arahatship.
For the sake of seeing the Buddha,
I always go to the city;
Even without going, I see
the form that delights the eyes.
Endowed with all perfections,
is better than a home for a lion.
I dwell without attachment
to form, which is full of all that is lovely.
The Victor, pleased with that quality,

analyzed: etat agge ṭhapesi ma  siṅgālakassa yā mātā
translated: placed me at the head of those
who have great faith.
I have mastery in psychic powers,
in the divine ear element,
and in the knowledge of the minds of others,
great sage.
I know my past lives,
and the divine eye is purified.
All the pollutants are destroyed,
there is no more of this mundane state.
In the meaning, the Dhamma, the phrasing,
and in ready speech,
knowledge has arisen in me, great hero,
in your presence.
My defilements are burnt up,
I dwell without pollutants.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
